subNodes.conversationText: ...So originally, you see, the man who came here in my likeness--Nevin--was supposed to survive. He was to give my brother the message that we would rendezvous somewhere secret--alas! Nevin was a young illusionist of much promise. We thought his death was not in vain, that it would lead our enemies to think I was truly dead. But if they want Vroman, they must know I still live.
[Dazed.] My brother, my brother...Alive, and yet--Couldn't you have let me know sooner? Hamfast and Danmar--you knew all along?!

Aye.  We were expecting Nevin in Manfred's stead.  But we knew that Manfred himself was being pursued, and thought it better to let any folk in town who weren't all that they seemed think he was dead.  We weren't even sure we could trust the two of you.  Our enemies have as many wiles as we do.
You couldn't trust me either? After all I have done for Drawn Swords.
Now Ianth, I'm surprised I knew. It was Danmar's decision to tell me, and I feel honored. It's not every day a normal man like me gets to know Harper business.

Keep your voice down, Hamfast! In any case, you, Miss Lavillus, and you, , have done more for Drawn Swords--and for us--than you realize. The fall of Darkhold, the Cyricist and Banite in-fighting, and now the revelation that at least the Cyricists know Manfred lives--all of this was news.

We now know why the Zhents are so scattered throughout the region--they were looking for Manfred!  But...The Zhentarim are not our greatest worry.  They want Manfred because they know he is valuable to the force that took Darkhold.
Would someone recapitulate?  We have been talking for an hour and I have yet to make sense of all of this.

Of course. In a nutshell, I have been living the life of... [Quietly]...One Who Harps...ever since the days of my apprenticeship as a diviner. In the course of my research, I ran afoul of a powerful organization who the Harpers were watching quite carefully.

I happened upon a secret valuable to this group.  They discovered what I knew and have been pursuing me ever since.  Vroman and I would have met some place else if Nevin, who traveled here in my likeness, had survived.  I wish that we knew how our enemies discovered so quickly that I still live.

Well, we are together now, and there is nothing stopping us from fleeing those who pursue you.  We could travel to the ends of Abeir-Toril...To--to Zakhara!  Remember when we used to pretend that we were caliphs of Huzuz?
[Danmar looks quietly at Vroman, and then at Manfred. His eyes, usually merry, seem sad.]

Do I remember? Of course! You were always the caliph, and I was the vizier. But...No. I did not want to meet with you so that we could flee together; I had other reasons. But let us speak of something else for the moment.
Though I feel as if I'm in the dark, I might be able to shed some new light on the situation. [Tell those gathered about Dunne and Obern, the spies who posed as Brother Anselm's acolytes.]

Of course! They must have found the note to Vroman when they buried him. They were waiting for his arrival here all along, and when the Cyricist discovered Manfred wasn't coming--and wasn't dead--, he planted the zombies in the crypt to lead you to his Banite partner, leaving him free to flee and tell the other Cyricists the news.
We believe ourselves to know more than you, and yet you reveal something new to us once again, . [Quietly.] You are a natural Harper!
What does the other organization you mentioned want from you, Manfred?
I wish I had known more before, but I suppose there's no use in regret or blame.
Perhaps knowing more will help me to understand your motives better.
I do not like being in the dark about things, but I suppose there's no help for it when Harpers are involved. And I bet you're not through with me yet.
What does this other organization want from you?
Very well.  I wish I had known more before, but I suppose there's no use in regret or blame.
Aye, there rarely is a use for either of those things.
Perhaps when I know more I will understand your motives better.
You shall know more. And perhaps your own motives--your reason for risking all--will be made clear to us.
I do not like being in the dark about things, but I suppose there's no help for it when Harpers are involved. And I bet you're not through with me yet.
[Quietly again.] You have served us better than our best allies, have risked all! We believe, nay, hope that you have what it takes to join us. To be a Harper yourself.
Besides doing all that you have done for us, you carry yourself with the kind of dignity and grace that reflects the disposition of one mindful of the Balance--even if you do not know it yet.
Those Who Harp would be honored to have you among our number once we are sure that you could learn and love our Code.  If you don't want this, we would still be honored to call you our friend.
Whatever you decide, I hope it means that you will continue to work with us.  I have more to tell you of the troubles facing me, us, and the region.

We have spoken enough tonight, though.  To speak of these things properly, we'll need to convene some place a little more remote.  If you wish to be a Harper yourself, our next meeting will also serve as your initiation.  So be prepared!
Your companions shall come as well, but only you are being given this invitation to join us.
That is good.  I respect the Harpers greatly, but my duty to Sune and my sacred oaths keep me from giving my loyalty to any organization besides the Ruby Rose.
I, too, have duties to my church; and while I am an adventurer, I do not know that it is the career best suited for me in the long run.
[A little dejectedly.] As I've always said, , you're the leader, the strong one. If I were Danmar I'd choose you too.
Danmar and I are going to leave Drawn Swords now, which is best for you, for us, and for the town itself.

Yes.  Revelian has recently returned from Corm Orp and will mind the inn.  <FirstName>, when you are ready, take the path through Northdark Wood to Harpers' Glade, in the south.  We can continue this conversation there.  Goodbye for now.
Yes, farewell!  And goodbye, my brother.  Do not fear--we will meet again soon.
[Shaking his head.] So soon? Couldn't we speak as brothers, not as adventurers whom events have thrown together?
You have done much for us, and behind all that you have done there seems to be something else--a good heart, a desire to understand others, a soul in sympathy with the Balance.
You seem to be virtuous in action, deed, and word.  "Virtue in freedom, freedom in virtue," is one of our watchwords.

You have done much for us; meanwhile, you carry yourself as easily as if you had not risked your life every day since you showed up in Drawn Swords. You laugh off trouble because you enjoy it--and getting into trouble is what we are known for.
Your deeds speak well of you, even if your words are, at times, abrasive.  All the better to do the work of the Balance, I say.
Your deeds speak well of you, but your motives and true feelings are not yet known to us.  You are mysterious.  Still--

I have an important piece of news I haven't shared yet. Perhaps you will be able to make something of it. [Tell those gathered about Dunne and Obern, the spies who posed as Brother Anselm's acolytes.]
I think I know how word got out that Manfred wasn't dead. [Tell those gathered about Dunne and Obern, the spies who posed as Brother Anselm's acolytes.]
Why are you being pursued, Manfred?  What is it that you know?

I happened upon a secret valuable to a powerful new organization of whom...[Quietly] Those Who Harp...have deep misgivings. They discovered what I knew and have been pursuing me ever since. Vroman and I would have met some place else if Nevin, who traveled here in my likeness, had survived. Alas!
Now is not the time or the place for me to divulge that, but rest assured that you will know the truth soon enough.
So I have unwittingly been doing Harpers' work.

I have been doing their work somewhat more wittingly, I'll admit. If it makes you feel better, we did not intend to draw you--or Lady Ianth--into this at all. But--[Manfred stops short and then begins to say something else; but you do not miss a curious, almost wondering look he gives you before he does.]
I, at least, am honored to have been a small puppet in the Harpers' manipulations, Manfred and Danmar. Sheela Peryroyl has many friends among Those Who Harp.
Thank you!  Tell your goddess that the feeling is mutual.  But back to business--
